title: Action Thriller 'Guns of Redemption' Trailer Starring Casper Van Dien
description: "How are you still alive?!" "I don't know..." Does he have some kind of Wolverine healing powers? Shout Studios has revealed an official trailer for an action thriller titled Guns of Redemption, another of these junk dime-a-dozen action movies. It's being released in March and will be available on VOD if anyone wants to watch. A stranger known only as Luke is a mysterious man with a violent past. A past marked by the scars on his face and the nightmares he can't escape. He takes off his guns hoping to find a new life. But there is no escape from a violent past. Old enemies find him and shoot him down. Before he bleeds to death or dies from the bullet lodged against his spine, he straps his guns on one last time to get vengeance. With his life running out, he goes after the murderous General Bork to avenge the death of the Man of God who took him in, and save Charlotte and Anna. Starring Casper Van Dien, James Logan, Sean Astin, Jeff Fahey, Curtis Lyons, Jesse Gallegos, Kim DeLonghi. This looks as forgettable as any film can - nothing to see. Here's the official trailer (+ [â€¦]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "How are you still alive?!" "I don't know..." Does he have some kind of Wolverine healing powers? Shout Studios has revealed an official trailer for an action thriller titled Guns of Redemption, another of these junk dime-a-dozen action movies. It's being released in March and will be available on VOD if anyone wants to watch.
text: TRAILERS by January 21, 2025Source: YouTube "How are you still alive?!" "I don't know..." Does he have some kind of Wolverine healing powers? Shout Studios has revealed an official trailer for an action thriller titled Guns of Redemption, another of these junk dime-a-dozen action movies. It's being released in March and will be available on VOD if anyone wants to watch. A stranger known only as Luke is a mysterious man with a violent past. A past marked by the scars on his face and the nightmares he can't escape. He takes off his guns hoping to find a new life. But there is no escape from a violent past. Old enemies find him and shoot him down. Before he bleeds to death or dies from the bullet lodged against his spine, he straps his guns on one last time to get vengeance. With his life running out, he goes after the murderous General Bork to avenge the death of the Man of God who took him in, and save Charlotte and Anna. Starring Casper Van Dien, James Logan, Sean Astin, Jeff Fahey, Curtis Lyons, Jesse Gallegos, Kim DeLonghi. This looks as forgettable as any film can - nothing to see. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Brian Skiba's Guns of Redemption, direct from YouTube: A stranger known only as Luke (Casper Van Dien) is a mysterious man with a violent past. A past marked by the scars on his face and the nightmares he can't escape. He takes off his guns to find a new life. But there is no escape... Old enemies find him & shoot him down. Before he bleeds to death, he straps his guns on one last time. He goes after the murderous General Bork (Jeff Fahey) to avenge the death of the Man of God (Sean Astin) who took him in, and saves Charlotte (Kaitlyn Kemp) and Anna (Siena Bjornerud), who are held captive in Bork's heinous web of evil. Guns of Redemption is directed by American filmmaker Brian Skiba, director of many, many junk action movies including Crushed Velvet, Dirty Little Trick, .357, Slaughter Creek, Merry Ex Mas, Beverly Hills Christmas, Chokehold, My Adventures with Santa, The 2nd, Pursuit, Killer Rivalry, Secret Society of Lies, Dead Man's Hand, Out of Hand, and Clear Cut previously. The screenplay is by Keith Merrill, from a story by Merrill and Jamie R. Thompson. Produced by Jamie R. Thompson. Shout debuts Guns of Redemption in select US theaters + on VOD starting March 7th, 2025. Find more posts in: To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
January 21, 2025
Source: YouTube

"How are you still alive?!" "I don't know..." Does he have some kind of Wolverine healing powers? Shout Studios has revealed an official trailer for an action thriller titled Guns of Redemption, another of these junk dime-a-dozen action movies. It's being released in March and will be available on VOD if anyone wants to watch. A stranger known only as Luke is a mysterious man with a violent past. A past marked by the scars on his face and the nightmares he can't escape. He takes off his guns hoping to find a new life. But there is no escape from a violent past. Old enemies find him and shoot him down. Before he bleeds to death or dies from the bullet lodged against his spine, he straps his guns on one last time to get vengeance. With his life running out, he goes after the murderous General Bork to avenge the death of the Man of God who took him in, and save Charlotte and Anna. Starring Casper Van Dien, James Logan, Sean Astin, Jeff Fahey, Curtis Lyons, Jesse Gallegos, Kim DeLonghi. This looks as forgettable as any film can - nothing to see.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Brian Skiba's Guns of Redemption, direct from YouTube:

A stranger known only as Luke (Casper Van Dien) is a mysterious man with a violent past. A past marked by the scars on his face and the nightmares he can't escape. He takes off his guns to find a new life. But there is no escape... Old enemies find him & shoot him down. Before he bleeds to death, he straps his guns on one last time. He goes after the murderous General Bork (Jeff Fahey) to avenge the death of the Man of God (Sean Astin) who took him in, and saves Charlotte (Kaitlyn Kemp) and Anna (Siena Bjornerud), who are held captive in Bork's heinous web of evil. Guns of Redemption is directed by American filmmaker Brian Skiba, director of many, many junk action movies including Crushed Velvet, Dirty Little Trick, .357, Slaughter Creek, Merry Ex Mas, Beverly Hills Christmas, Chokehold, My Adventures with Santa, The 2nd, Pursuit, Killer Rivalry, Secret Society of Lies, Dead Man's Hand, Out of Hand, and Clear Cut previously. The screenplay is by Keith Merrill, from a story by Merrill and Jamie R. Thompson. Produced by Jamie R. Thompson. Shout debuts Guns of Redemption in select US theaters + on VOD starting March 7th, 2025.

Find more posts in: To Watch, Trailer
